Class Percolation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Percolation

  • public class Percolation
extends java.lang.Object
    Percolation Model. This class provides methods for modeling a grid based percolating system. The API here is designed by Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayne as part of their online Coursera class.
    Author:
    Bryan Goodrich

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Percolation(int N)
      Creates a percolation system The model is a square NxN state grid that uses a union-find data structure to manage the site (cell) connections.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isFull(int i, int j)
      Checks if a given site is full (percolates to these coordinates)
      boolean isOpen(int i, int j)
      Checks if a given site is open
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Test client for executing a model from an input file The file must begin with grid size N on the first line.
      void open(int i, int j)
      Opens a site at the given coordinates Opening a site includes both changing its grid state as well as connecting it in the union-find structure to its grid neighbors above, below, left, and right if those neighbors are also open.
      boolean percolates()
      Checks if the system percolates from top to bottom

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Percolation

        public Percolation(int N)
        Creates a percolation system The model is a square NxN state grid that uses a union-find data structure to manage the site (cell) connections. The top and bottom layers of the grid are attached to virtual sites in the union-find structure at initialization, providing for easier ways to identify percolation across the system
        Parameters:
        N - the size of the square state grid for this model

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(int i,
        int j)
        Opens a site at the given coordinates Opening a site includes both changing its grid state as well as connecting it in the union-find structure to its grid neighbors above, below, left, and right if those neighbors are also open.
        Parameters:
        i - x-coordinate of site beginning from northwest corner
        j - y-coordinate of site beginning from northwest corner

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen(int i,
             int j)
        Checks if a given site is open
        Parameters:
        i - x-coordinate of site beginning from northwest corner
        j - y-coordinate of site beginning from northwest corner
        Returns:
        true if grid states this site is open

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull(int i,
             int j)
        Checks if a given site is full (percolates to these coordinates)
        Parameters:
        i - x-coordinate of site beginning from northwest corner
        j - y-coordinate of site beginning from northwest corner
        Returns:
        true if the site is open and connected to an open site in the first layer

      • percolates

        public boolean percolates()
        Checks if the system percolates from top to bottom
        Returns:
        true if the virtual top and bottom are connected as represented in the union-find data structure

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test client for executing a model from an input file The file must begin with grid size N on the first line. Proceeding lines must include pairs of integers separated by whitespaces for which cells in the grid to open
